content.overview: RecyclerView makes it easy to efficiently display large sets of data. You supply the data and define how each item looks, and the RecyclerView library dynamically creates the elements when they're needed.As the name implies, RecyclerView recycles those individual elements. When an item scrolls off the screen, RecyclerView doesn't destroy its view. Instead, RecyclerView reuses the view for new items that have scrolled onscreen. This reuse vastly improves performance, improving your app's responsiveness and reducing power consumption.

events.name: OnWidgetClicked
events.description: Event generated when any widget is clicked.For this event to be fired by a widget, it must have the respective property,"Clickable".

events.name: OnWidgetLongClicked
events.description: Event generated when any widget is long clicked.For this event to be fired by a widget, it must have the respective property,"Clickable".

events.name: OnBindingRequest
events.description: Event launched when a group changes its position and needs to update its widgets.

events.name: OnBindingCustomView
events.description: Event fired when the custom widget that is optionally configured in the RecyclerView is visible on the screen or needs to be updated.

events.name: FastScrolled
events.description: Event launched when the "Listenable Scroll" method finished and the group being navigated to is already visible on the screen.

events.name: ItemSwiped
events.description: Event launched when a group triggers a swipe action.Indicates whether the action corresponds to the right or left side.

events.name: MultiSelectionOptionSelected
events.description: Event triggered when an option is selected in multiple selection mode.

methods.name: AddSelectionIconOption
methods.description: Adds options with icons to the multi-selection bar.
info: These options will be added to the selection bar.
The icon is the name of a file in assets or the path to an image file.

methods.name: AddSelectionOption
methods.description: Adds options to the multi-selection bar.
info: An option to select all items can be set with the SelectAllTitle property.

methods.name: Build
methods.description: Finishes with the recyclerview configuration and adds it inside the specified component.
info: It is preferable not to add it inside a Scroll Arrangement, but it can be added inside a Swipe Refresh Layout or other arrangement.

methods.name: GetCurrentScrollPixels
methods.description: Returns the offset position the recyclerview is currently in, the value is returned in pixels.

methods.name: GetGroupForPosition
methods.description: Returns the group corresponding to an adapter position (linked to the number of items in the data list). It will only return a valid position if the corresponding group is visible on the screen.
info: It should be used when we are sure that the item corresponding to the position is visible on the screen, for example after using the ListenableScroll method.

methods.name: GetLastSyncedWidget
methods.description: Returns the last widget synced with the RecyclerView.
info: The returned widget cannot be edited with the Kodular blocks, but it does allow it to be used with extensions such as the Widget Animator or widget Screenshot.

methods.name: GetRootName
methods.description: Returns a name that is used to identify the first widget to be added to the RecyclerView model.
info: This block tells the RecyclerView that it is starting to create the model.

methods.name: GetScrollRangePixels
methods.description: Returns the maximum scroll position of the RecyclerView. It is returned in pixels.

methods.name: ListenableScrollTo
methods.description: Causes the RecyclerView to go to a certain position and calls the FastScroll event when it is done scrolling.

methods.name: NotifyDataSetChanged
methods.description: Notifies the recyclerview that a change occurred in the data list, because of this, it will have to update the widgets.

methods.name: ScrollTo
methods.description: Causes the RecyclerView to scroll to the specified position. It does not notify when it is done.

methods.name: SetCustomView
methods.description: Sets the component that will be displayed among the RecyclerView items.

methods.name: SetGridManager
methods.description: Sets the layout manager to Grid, so that the items in the RecyclerView will be displayed with columns or rows, depending on the orientation.

methods.name: SetListManager
methods.description: Sets the layout manager to List, so the items in the RecyclerView will be listed horizontally or vertically depending on the orientation.

methods.name: SetScrollListener
methods.description: It establishes the procedure that is responsible for listening to the changes of state when scrolling in the RecyclerView.
info: The addresses are automatically detected depending on the layout manager.
In a horizontal manager the procedure should have the following parameters: [canScrollToLeft, canScrollToRight, isIddle]
In a vertical manager they should be: [canScrollToTop, canScrollToBottom, isIddle]
The isIddle parameter refers to whether the RecyclerView is idle.

methods.name: SetStaggeredGridManager
methods.description: Sets the layout manager as a staggered grid. It will be displayed in columns or rows depending on the orientation.

methods.name: SetSwipeForViewTypes
methods.description: It establishes in which direction or in which directions each type of view can be scrolled.
info: The letters l, r, and b are used to indicate the left, right, and both sides respectively.

Rules structure:
[view-type]:[side]
Example:"4: l, 5: r, 6: b"

methods.name: SetViewTypeProvider
methods.description: It establishes the procedure that is in charge of returning the type of view according to the position that the RecyclerView returns.
info: The procedure must have the parameters [position, listItem]
It must return a type of view, it must be one created previously.

methods.name: SmoothScrollTo
methods.description: Causes the RecyclerView to scroll smoothly to a specific position.
info: It does not notify any event if it finished with its task.

methods.name: Sync
methods.description: It is mainly used when configuring the RecyclerView for the first time, it tells all the components that depend on it that this RecyclerView is currently being worked on.

methods.name: SyncWidget
methods.description: Synchronizes a widget with the RecyclerView. It is mainly used to edit the widgets.

methods.name: SyncWithViewType
methods.description: Synchronizes the RecyclerView and also introduce a new type of view in it.

methods.name: UpdateData
methods.description: Changes the data list bound to the RecyclerView, notifies you that it should be redrawn according to the new list.

methods.name: UpdateVisibleItem
methods.description: Notifies the RecyclerView that it has to redraw an item regardless of whether the linked list underwent a change.

properties.name: DividerColor
properties.description: Sets the color of the division between the groups.

properties.name: DividerSize
properties.description: Sets the height/width of the division between the groups.

properties.name: CustomView
properties.description: Sets whether the RecyclerView will show a component among its groups.

properties.name: CustomViewItemsOffset
properties.description: Sets the number of items to be displayed before displaying the set component.

properties.name: MultiSelection
properties.description: Sets whether multi-selection is enabled.

properties.name: MultiSelectionSuffix
properties.description: Sets the text that will be displayed after the number of items selected in the selection bar.

properties.name: SelectAllTitle
properties.description: Sets the title of the option button to make a selection of all items.

properties.name: MultiSelectionOpacity
properties.description: Sets the opacity of the group when it is selected.
info: Values range from 0.0 to 1.0

properties.name: MultiSelectionColor
properties.description: Sets the background color of the group when selected.

properties.name: SwipeActions
properties.description: Specifies whether swipe actions will be available to the RecyclerView.

properties.name: SwipeDirection
properties.description: Specify the available sides to trigger swipe actions. "Left, Right and Both".
info: Sides can be specified for each view type with the "SetSwipeForViewTypes" method.

properties.name: SwipeThreshold
properties.description: The fraction that the user should move the group to be considered as swiped.
info: Values range from 0.0 to 1.0
The fraction is calculated with respect to RecyclerView's bounds.

properties.name: SwipeVelocityThreshold
properties.description: Defines the maximum velocity ItemTouchHelper will ever calculate for pointer movements.
info: Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
If you increase the value, it will be easier for the user to swipe diagonally and if you decrease the value, user will need to make a rather straight finger movement to trigger a swipe.

properties.name: SwipeLeftSideColor
properties.description: Specifies the background color of the action on the left side.

properties.name: SwipeRightSideColor
properties.description: Specifies the background color of the action on the right side.

properties.name: SwipeLeftRevealColor
properties.description: Specifies the color of the wave that indicates that the action on the left side is considered to be launched.

properties.name: SwipeRightRevealColor
properties.description: Specifies the color of the wave that indicates that the action on the right side is considered to be launched.

properties.name: SwipeLeftSideIcon
properties.description: Specifies the image file name that the RecyclerView will display in the action on the left side.
info: The file must be located in the assets of the project. Only the name plus the extension should be entered.
If the image is too large it will be resized.

properties.name: SwipeRightSideIcon
properties.description: Specifies the image file name that the RecyclerView will display in the action on the right side.

properties.name: Visible
properties.description: Specifies RecyclerView visibility.

properties.name: FixedSize
properties.description: Specifies whether the RecyclerView will have a fixed size.
info: If enabled, the size of the RecyclerView does not depend on its children. This means that it does not have to be constantly resized, thus preventing performance variations.

properties.name: BackgroundColor
properties.description: Sets the background color of the RecyclerView.

properties.name: BackgroundAsset
properties.description: Sets the background image of the RecyclerView.
info: The file must be located in the assets of the project. Only the name plus the extension should be entered.

properties.name: Width
properties.description: Sets the width of the RecyclerView.
info: Allowed values are Automatic and FillParent
To specify a different size, change it in the component where the RecyclerView will be created.

properties.name: Height
properties.description: Sets the height of the RecyclerView.
info: Allowed values are Automatic and FillParent
To specify a different size, change it in the component where the RecyclerView will be created.
